chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvador Q Escobedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child AMENDED FROM Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, school or a combination of both.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Contact with minors under the age of 18 will be up to the agent. Sex offender assessment and follow recommendations. Comply with sex offender registry.   No contact with the victim A.M.S. (person, property, residence or family). Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Sentencing Report prepared by Jacqueline A Schmidt
from Atty Patrick Cafferty forwarding documentation for review with regard to 6/17/16 sentencing
Sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, AMS (person, property, residence or family).  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
08/28/15 - BOND MODIFIED: House arrest at 3417 S Green Bay Rd. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant be placed on electronic monitoring.  Zimmerman Consulting Inc (ZCI), located at 524 S Main St in Racine (262-632-1780) to monitor.  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing or your release from custody. May leave home for school, school, work, therapy/counseling - with documentation provided to ZCI. No cont w/anyone under age 18.

**AMENDED 3-22-2016:  Defendant is allowed to attend Easter family gathering.  Must be in visual presence of M.E. and/'or M.E, M.B., J.M., L.E.**
